content:
For the eCR IG (US Realm) we include a link ( https://ecr.aimsplatform.org/). I can't access it from here unless I change location with a VPN to the USA (which is correct, it's a US only link). (http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/branches/master/index.html)

But the IG Publisher is erroring "The link 'ecr.aimsplatform.org' for "ecr.aimsplatform.org" cannot be resolved" (http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/branches/master/qa.html )

@Grahame Grieve Is this an error we can ignore? Or something you can fix?
Actually wondering if changing the link text to https://ecr.aimsplatform.org will fix it. Just trying that now. One wouldn't think it would matter as it's the text, but...
it's awesomely disgraceful to have content that is forbidden to browsers whose public ip geolocates to outside USA.
however, I don't believe that has anything to do with this error, since there's no logic to check external links (how could there be?). Where exactly are you using it?

Just in some text on the main page: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/branches/master/index.html
Search for "aims".
I just rebuilt and the link error is gone! Did you change something @Grahame Grieve ??
I guess I did something that fixed it then... Wierd. Clearly something I did wrong then.
it's because I said it should actually work

Ack - I think it was a trailing "/" that screwed it up. I actually don't remember removing it, but I clearly did and now it works. I'm blaming jetlag (though you're probably the last person I should use that excuse with!)...
I might be good at appreciating it
